snippet: The government lashed out at criticism from the United Nations and the American envoy over the expulsion of Matthew Rosenberg, saying a report by him was an act of espionage.
abstract: Afghan government lashes out at criticism of its expulsion of New York Times journalist Matthew Rosenberg, saying his report on electoral crisis in Afghanistan was an act of espionage; Rosenberg left Kabul within 24-hour deadline imposed by Afghan attorney general's office.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Rod Nordland reported from Kabul, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The government lashed out at criticism from the United Nations and the American envoy over the expulsion of Matthew Rosenberg, saying a report by him was an act of espionage.

headline.main: Afghanistan Defends Expulsion of a Times Reporter
headline.print_headline: Afghanistan Defends Expulsion of a Times Reporter
